description: Gets an OTA update. Requires permission to access the GetOTAUpdate action.

nested_items.name: otaUpdateInfo
nested_items.description: The OTA update info.

nested_items.name: otaUpdateId
nested_items.description: The OTA update ID.

nested_items.name: otaUpdateArn
nested_items.description: The OTA update ARN.

nested_items.name: creationDate
nested_items.description: The date when the OTA update was created.

nested_items.name: lastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date when the OTA update was last updated.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A description of the OTA update.

nested_items.name: targets
nested_items.description: The targets of the OTA update.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: protocols
nested_items.description: The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified, the target device can choose the protocol.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration for the rollout of OTA updates.

nested_items.name: maximumPerMinute
nested_items.description: The maximum number of OTA update job executions started per minute.

nested_items.name: exponentialRate
nested_items.description: The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an exponential rate increase for a job rollout.

nested_items.name: baseRatePerMinute
nested_items.description: The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute, at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate of the rollout.

nested_items.name: incrementFactor
nested_items.description: The rate of increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified is multiplied by this factor.

nested_items.name: rateIncreaseCriteria
nested_items.description: The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.

nested_items.name: numberOfNotifiedThings
nested_items.description: When this number of things have been notified, it will initiate an increase in the rollout rate.

nested_items.name: numberOfSucceededThings
nested_items.description: When this number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it will initiate an increase in the rollout rate.

nested_items.name: awsJobPresignedUrlConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when protocols contains HTTP.

nested_items.name: expiresInSec
nested_items.description: How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when a request for the job document is received.

nested_items.name: targetSelection
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the OTA update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the OTA update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, an OTA update will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the OTA update was completed by all things originally in the group.

nested_items.name: otaUpdateFiles
nested_items.description: A list of files associated with the OTA update.

nested_items.name: fileName
nested_items.description: The name of the file.

nested_items.name: fileType
nested_items.description: An integer value you can include in the job document to allow your devices to identify the type of file received from the cloud.

nested_items.name: fileVersion
nested_items.description: The file version.

nested_items.name: fileLocation
nested_items.description: The location of the updated firmware.

nested_items.name: streamId
nested_items.description: The stream ID.

nested_items.name: fileId
nested_items.description: The ID of a file associated with a stream.

nested_items.name: s3Location
nested_items.description: The location of the updated firmware in S3.

nested_items.name: bucket
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The S3 key.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket version.

nested_items.name: codeSigning
nested_items.description: The code signing method of the file.

nested_items.name: awsSignerJobId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AWSSignerJob which was created to sign the file.

nested_items.name: startSigningJobParameter
nested_items.description: Describes the code-signing job.

nested_items.name: signingProfileParameter
nested_items.description: Describes the code-signing profile.

nested_items.name: certificateArn
nested_items.description: Certificate ARN.

nested_items.name: platform
nested_items.description: The hardware platform of your device.

nested_items.name: certificatePathOnDevice
nested_items.description: The location of the code-signing certificate on your device.

nested_items.name: signingProfileName
nested_items.description: The code-signing profile name.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The location to write the code-signed file.

nested_items.name: s3Destination
nested_items.description: Describes the location in S3 of the updated firmware.

nested_items.name: bucket
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket that contains the updated firmware.

nested_items.name: prefix
nested_items.description: The S3 prefix.

nested_items.name: customCodeSigning
nested_items.description: A custom method for code signing a file.

nested_items.name: signature
nested_items.description: The signature for the file.

nested_items.name: inlineDocument
nested_items.description: A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing signature.

nested_items.name: certificateChain
nested_items.description: The certificate chain.

nested_items.name: certificateName
nested_items.description: The name of the certificate.

nested_items.name: inlineDocument
nested_items.description: A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing certificate chain.

nested_items.name: hashAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The hash algorithm used to code sign the file. You can use a string as the algorithm name if the target over-the-air (OTA) update devices are able to verify the signature that was generated using the same signature algorithm. For example, FreeRTOS uses SHA256 or SHA1, so you can pass either of them based on which was used for generating the signature.

nested_items.name: signatureAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The signature algorithm used to code sign the file. You can use a string as the algorithm name if the target over-the-air (OTA) update devices are able to verify the signature that was generated using the same signature algorithm. For example, FreeRTOS uses ECDSA or RSA, so you can pass either of them based on which was used for generating the signature.

nested_items.name: attributes
nested_items.description: A list of name-attribute pairs. They won't be sent to devices as a part of the Job document.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: otaUpdateStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the OTA update.

nested_items.name: awsIotJobId
nested_items.description: The IoT job ID associated with the OTA update.

nested_items.name: awsIotJobArn
nested_items.description: The IoT job ARN associated with the OTA update.

nested_items.name: errorInfo
nested_items.description: Error information associated with the OTA update.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The error message.

nested_items.name: additionalParameters
nested_items.description: A collection of name/value pairs.
(string) ---
(string) ---
